text: . Ensures the safe and efficient operation of the resort’s common areas and related amenities, including but not limited to pools, Jacuzzi’s and water features! These assignments relate to a variety of trades that include but are not limited to carpentry, plumbing, painting and masonry. What will I be doing? Perform maintenance and repairs on pool surfaces, pool decks and furniture (furniture, fixtures and equipment). Exterior showers, assist in pump, valve or plumbing replacement, change out pool lights, perform pool cleaning in support of quality standards, remove scum, clean strainers, netting, vacuuming, backwashing, perform daily water tests and adjust chemicals as needed. Mechanical maintenance of all associated equipment: such as filters and plumbing. Able to respond to protein spills in the waterways. Communicate and execute preventative maintenance. Replaces faulty sections of pipe, valves, and fittings, using plumbing tools. Lubricates machines and equipment. Communicates to Contractors/vendors. Maintain inventory of parts and lubricants. Conducts and records daily pool readings. Maintain a clean, neat pool pump rooms, sweeping and cleaning as necessary. Maintain accurate functioning of all equipment and tools. Establishes a clear line of communication with the engineering leadership. Trains other mechanics on pool procedures when asked. Assist other maintenance staff on special projects as directed by engineering leadership. Specific Job Knowledge, Skill and Ability: This requires the individual to possess considerable knowledge of a wide variety of maintenance trades in order to visually inspect and detect items needing repair. Skill in the use of related tools (including both hand and electric tools). Qualifications. What are we looking for? Basic mechanical aptitude. Basic English language communication in order to communicate with co-workers and fully comprehend job assignments. Ability to perform tasks requiring bending, stooping and kneeling. Ability to push and pull objects or materials weighing up to 100 lbs. Ability to wear fitted respirator. Ability to grasp, lift or carry items weighing up to 50 lbs., occasionally waist high. Regular attendance in conformance with the standards, which may be established and revised by HGVC form time to time, is essential to the successful performance of this position. Required Qualifications: Ability to follow basic written and verbal directions, climb stairs and work on ladders up to 40 feet, push/pull up to 100 lbs., lift/carry up to 50 lbs., grasp, stoop, reach overhead.
